definition: to escort a criminal under guard (in former times)
to hand over/to pass on sth/to gradually increase or decrease/progressively
acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection

sentences.english: He now focuses on border security and deportation of illegal immigrants.
sentences.chinese: 他如今注重於邊界安全和遞解非法移民問題。

sentences.english: S. visa, if been unlawfully present in, or deported from, the United States?
sentences.chinese: 是否曾非法進入美國或曾被美國遞解出境？

sentences.english: He was deported the next day.
sentences.chinese: 他在第二天就被遞解出境了。

sentences.english: Have you ever been refused admission to the U. S.
sentences.chinese: 您是否曾經被美國拒絕入境或成爲遞解出境的對象？

sentences.english: Officer to handcuff a prisoner to his right hand?
sentences.chinese: 自己的右手和他遞解的囚犯銬在一起的？
